intro: Stenochilus glaber, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, unbranched stems. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil. Stenochilus glaber is often cultivated for its ornamental value and unique floral structure.
